title: SaveAs Forgets the file type
description: The SaveAs function is not remembering the file type and the icon has changed from the parent Java file icon to a generic file icon.
OB: 1) Open an existing Java file. 2) Modify the file (e.g., move an existing class). 3) Click the SaveAs icon, located next to the Save icon. A dialog box will appear. 4) Browse for a valid container location. 5) Type the filename without including the file extension, as it is not requested. 6) Click Ok. 7) Observe that the file is added to the specified location in the Navigator, but without a file extension displayed.
EB: After performing the SaveAs function, the file should retain the correct file type and the icon should remain as the parent Java file icon.
SR: When using the SaveAs feature, ensure that the file type is remembered and the icon is not changed.
